title: Cara Mengatasi Asam Lambung
description:
Lambung bertugas memecah makanan yang masuk agar dapat diserap tubuh. Asam lambung sengaja dihasilkan oleh lambung untuk mempermudah pekerjaannya tersebut. Namun ketika jumlah asam yang dihasilkan malah terlalu banyak, maka dapat menyebabkan masalah lambung, seperti refluks asam lambung

Refluks asam lambung adalah aliran balik asam lambung atau naiknya asam lambung ke kerongkongan. Aliran balik asam ini sebenarnya merupakan bagian normal dari pergerakan sistem pencernaan, sehingga refluks asam lambung tidak bisa dikatakan sebagai penyakit.

title: Esophageal Cancer
description: Esophageal cancer is cancer arising from the esophagus‚Äîthe food pipe that runs between the throat and the stomach. Symptoms often include difficulty in swallowing and weight loss. Other symptoms may include pain when swallowing, a hoarse voice, enlarged lymph nodes ("glands") around the collarbone, a dry cough, and possibly coughing up or vomiting blood. The two main sub-types of the disease are esophageal squamous-cell carcinoma (often abbreviated to ESCC), which is more common in the developing world, and esophageal adenocarcinoma (EAC), which is more common in the developed world. A number of less common types also occur. Squamous-cell carcinoma arises from the epithelial cells that line the esophagus. Adenocarcinoma arises from glandular cells present in the lower third of the esophagus, often where they have already transformed to intestinal cell type (a condition known as Barrett's esophagus). Causes of the squamous-cell type include tobacco, alcohol, very hot drinks, poor diet, and chewing betel nut.[3][4] The most common causes of the adenocarcinoma type are smoking tobacco, obesity, and acid reflux.

title: 98point6
description:
98point6 provides on-demand diagnosis, treatment and consultation from board-certified physicians and sends necessary prescriptions to your pharmacy‚Äîall via secure, in-app messaging. Our unique, text-based care delivery means you can get the right care at the right time. No appointments, no travel. We‚Äôre available nationwide, 24/7, 365 days a year. 

HOW MUCH DOES IT COST?
There are two ways to get 98point6: via a Personal Plan or a Sponsored Plan.

Personal Plans subscriptions come at an introductory rate of $30 for the first 3 months, with unlimited access to on-demand care for just $1 per visit. When that initial period ends, you have the option to enroll in an annual plan for only $120 per year + $1 per visit. (Please note, only one patient per account. You must be 18+ to create an account and seek care; 19+ in Nebraska.)

Some employers, health plans and retailers provide access to 98point6 at no charge and offer visits at low/no cost to eligible members and their dependents ages 1+. To see if you're eligible, please check with your plan sponsor.

WHAT DOES MY PERSONAL PLAN SUBSCRIPTION COVER?
Your 98point6 Personal Plan provides you access to our board-certified physicians who offer consultation, diagnosis and treatment. Insurance is not required for your visits. Patients are responsible for any outside-of-app costs, including prescriptions, labs and visits to an in-person physician, if referred. 

WHO ARE YOUR DOCTORS?
Our virtual clinic is staffed by carefully selected, board-certified physicians who are passionate about making care more accessible and affordable. They are specially trained to treat and diagnose via text-based care. (98point6 supports photo, video and audio as needed.)

WHAT CAN YOU TREAT? 
Our board-certified physicians are available on-demand to diagnose and treat, answer questions, offer peace of mind and when it matters, guide you towards the most appropriate next steps. If your issue does require in-person care, you can be sure you‚Äôre on the right path to feeling better after consulting with a 98point6 physician. 
 
Common conditions we treat include:
‚Ä¢ Cold, cough and flu
‚Ä¢ Urinary tract infections (UTI)
‚Ä¢ Acid reflux, heartburn and digestive issues
‚Ä¢ Yeast infections or sexually transmitted infections (STIs) 
‚Ä¢ Muscle sprains and strains
‚Ä¢ Seasonal allergies, asthma and respiratory issues
‚Ä¢ Skin conditions, rashes, bites and sunburn
‚Ä¢ Women‚Äôs health, such as birth control 
‚Ä¢ Nausea, stomach flu and gastroenteritis 
‚Ä¢ General health questions
‚Ä¢ ...and more
 
WHAT IS YOUR PRESCRIPTION POLICY? 
Our doctors can prescribe a wide variety of medications. However, we do not prescribe controlled substances (such as Percocet), muscle relaxants (such as Flexeril), lifestyle medications (such as Viagra or Propecia) or medications that require strict monitoring. Our physicians adhere to evidence-based standards with respect to the responsible use of antibiotics. If we are unable to prescribe a medication, it‚Äôs likely due to a combination of factors, including state and federal regulations related to virtual care practices, as well as what‚Äôs in the best interest of your safety and well-being. 
 
Note: 98point6 is not for medical emergencies.

title: Gastritis Treatment - Gastritis Diet
description:
Gastritis is a condition that affects a person's stomach lining, causing it to become inflamed. Some cases of gastritis can be treated at home with simple remedies.
There are many factors that can cause a gastritis flare-up

Gastritis refers to inflammation of the stomach lining, so consuming a diet that helps to minimize inflammation may provide relief over time. However, research has not conclusively shown that eating a certain diet causes or prevents gastritis.

By keeping a food diary, people can identify which foods trigger their symptoms. They can then begin to reduce their intake or avoid certain foods altogether.

The conventional gastritis treatment involves taking antacids or other drugs to reduce stomach acid. While these drugs work quickly to ease symptoms, chronic use of these medications can lead to severe problems, such as osteoporosis or a condition called hypchlorhydria (low stomach acid).

Popping antacid pills may mask your gastritis symptoms, but they likely won‚Äôt provide a gastritis cure. Instead, adopt a gastritis diet, which can correct the root causes of gastritis while helping to you heal your gut naturally. (See sidebar below: ‚Äú4 Main Causes of Gastritis.‚Äù)

Home remedies for gastritis include eating a combination of healthy foods while simultaneously avoiding the food ‚Äúculprits‚Äù on a daily basis. This is the key for permanent gastritis treatment.


Inclusive content of below topics:-

Introduction
Symptoms of Acute Gastritis
The 10 Top Tips for Gastritis
Foods to Include in the Diet for Gastritis
Foods That Should Be Excluded From the Diet
Food rules

title: Get Rid of Constipation Naturally
description:
Constipation is a disorder of the digestive tract. When you suffer from constipation your bowels don't regularly move or they are not emptied completely. Unfortunately constipation can cause many diseases because this disorder produces many toxins and these can reach in the blood stream and in this way they are carried in all your body.

People of all ages can suffer from constipation taking into account that it is one of the most common digestive disorders. Most of the time this disorder is just temporary and it can be treated very easy. A great attention must be paid to the chronic constipation. It must be not neglected because it can lead to hemorrhoids, fecal impaction, piles, fecal incontinence, and anal fissures.

Fortunately this digestive disorder can be treated very easy. More on, there are lots of natural treatments that can help you to get rid of it.

Symptoms

Constipation has many symptoms: from difficulty, infrequency or irregularity in elimination of hard fecal matter, foul breath, loss of appetite, coated tongue, dizziness, headache, dark circles under the eyes to dark circles under the eyes, depression, ulcer in mouth, varicose veins, acidity, insomnia, pain in the lumbar region, constant fullness in the abdomen and varicose veins.

Causes

The main causes of constipation are a fault style of life and a fault diet. Stress can be a cause, too.

Natural Treatments

Most of the fruits except jack fruit and banana are very useful in constipation treatments. Of course some are more effective than others. For example Bael fruit is considered the best natural laxative. But there are many other fruits that can help you to treat this digestive disorder as well.

Pears are very beneficial to treat constipation. If you eat a pear during your breakfast or after dinner, its effects will be surprising.

Guava is another natural remedy. If you eat it with seeds, it provides your diet roughage. Eat one or two guavas every day and you will not suffer from constipation anymore.

Besides the fact that they are very tasty, grapes are a merciless enemy of constipation.

Grapes contain sugar, organic acid and cellulose and this combination make them to be a great natural laxative. Besides the fact that they clear the bowels they also tone up intestines and the stomach. Eat at least 350 gm of grapes daily.

Oranges can help you, too. Eat one or two oranges at dinner and at breakfast and the problem is resoled. Figs and papaya are very useful, too. You can also treat your constipation with spinach. Squeeze half of a lime in a glass of hot water and mix it with 5 gm of salt. You can also swallow a teaspoon of linseed with a glass of water before your meals. Drinking a glass of water in which you put a teaspoon of honey is another way to get rid of constipation. Drink teas made from herbal known as good laxatives. Drink horse gowan tea for example.

Anyway a diet rich in fresh fruits and vegetables will help you not to suffer from constipation.

title: Heartburn App 1
description:
Burning Issues On Heartburn


You‚Äôve just eaten a big meal and leaned back in your favorite chair to watch your favorite TV program. As you begin to relax, your chest starts to hurt so much it feels like it‚Äôs on fire. You may be experiencing heartburn.



According to studies, about 30% of adults experience occasional heartburn, while 10% experience heartburn almost every single every day. Heartburn is common, and an occasional episode is generally nothing to worry about.



However, many people have already considered heartburn as a uncomfortable condition that requires medication or medical attention.



Heartburn usually follows after a heavy meal. To understand how this condition comes about, it is best to be aware of what exactly happens when we eat food.



The food that is swallowed travels from the mouth to the stomach through a hollow tube called the esophagus. Before food enters the stomach, it must pass through a tight muscle at the lower part of the esophagus called the Lower Esophageal Sphincter (LES).



The lower esophageal sphincter prevents food from traveling backward into the esophagus. Once in the stomach, stomach acid slowly digests the food. This acid is very strong and can damage most parts of the body.



Fortunately, the stomach is protected from its own acid by a special mucous layer. The esophagus, however, does not have any such special protection. If the lower esophageal sphincter does not close completely, the lower part of the esophagus can be damaged by stomach acid. When this happens, heartburn is experienced.



Heartburn can last for several hours and is often worse after eating, or when lying down, or when a person who just ate suddenly bends over. Heartburn is the most common symptom of reflux. Reflux occurs when acid in the stomach, which is there to help digest food, rises up into the esophagus, causing pain, irritation, and discomfort.



Some other factors that can make heartburn worse include certain foods such as fatty and spicy foods, chocolate, caffeine, onions, tomato sauce, carbonated beverages and mint. Alcohol, large meals, lying too soon after eating, cigarette smoking, sedatives, calcium channel blockers and antidepressant medications can also trigger heartburn.



Heartburn, also called acid indigestion, is the most common symptom of gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD); a disease in which stomach acid or, occasionally, bile flows back (refluxes) into the esophagus.



Heartburn usually feels like a burning chest pain beginning behind the breastbone and moving upward to the neck and throat. Many people say it feels like food is coming back into the mouth leaving an acid or bitter taste.



Most heartburn problems are mild, but if a person experiences frequent discomfort, there may already be some complications that need medical treatment or the use of prescription medications.



If a person encounters heartburn several times a week, or if it returns soon after the effects of antacids wear off, medical attention may be necessary. A person with heartburn should also consult a doctor if he or she often wakes up at night due to discomfort brought about by reflux.



One may need further medical care, or possibly even surgery, if a person experience difficulty swallowing, regurgitates blood or black material, suddenly loses weight, or if the stool is black in color.



Most people can manage the discomfort of heartburn with lifestyle modifications and over-the-counter medications. But if heartburn is severe, these remedies may offer only temporary or partial relief.



Heartburn pain can be mistaken for the pain associated with heart disease or a heart attack, but there are differences. Heartburn pain is less likely to be associated with physical activity. Exercise may aggravate pain resulting from heart disease, and rest may relieve the pain

title: Sore Throat: Causes, Diagnosis, and Management
description:
Sore throat, also known as throat pain, is pain or irritation of the throat. It is usually caused by pharyngitis (inflammation of the throat) or tonsillitis (inflammation of the tonsils). It can also result from trauma. About 7.5% of people have a sore throat in any three-month period. 
A sore throat is usually from irritation or inflammation. The most common cause (80%) is acute viral pharyngitis, a viral infectionof the throat. Other causes include other infections (such as streptococcal pharyngitis), trauma, and tumors. Gastroesophageal (acid) reflux disease can cause stomach acid to back up into the throat and also cause the throat to become sore. In children streptococcal pharyngitis is the cause of 37% of sore throats.

title: Alkaline Diet for Beginner
description:
Alkaline diet (also known as the alkaline ash diet, alkaline acid diet, acid ash diet, and acid alkaline diet) describes a group of loosely related diets based on the misconception that different types of food can have an effect on the pH balance of the body. It originated from theories related to osteoporosis research, however, most proponents of the diet maintain the incorrect belief that certain foods can affect the acidity (pH) of the body and can therefore be used to treat or prevent disease. Due to the lack of credible evidence supporting the claimed mechanism of this diet, it is not recommended by dietitians or other health professionals, though some have noted that eating unprocessed foods as this diet recommends may have incidental health benefits unrelated to bodily pH.

These diets have been promoted by alternative medicine practitioners, with the proposal that such diets treat or prevent cancer, heart disease, and low energy levels as well as other illnesses. Human blood is regulated at pH 7.35 to 7.45. Levels above 7.45 are referred to as alkaloids and levels below 7.35 as acidosis. Both are potentially serious, and the body has acid‚Äìbase homeostasis mechanisms that generally ensure this does not happen. The idea that these diets can materially affect blood pH for the purpose of treating a range of diseases is not supported by scientific research and makes incorrect assumptions about how alkaline diets function that are contrary to human physiology.

Diets avoiding meat, poultry, cheese, and grains can be used in order to make the urine more alkaline (higher pH). However, difficulties in effectively predicting the effects of this diet have led to medications, rather than diet modification, as the preferred method of changing urine pH. The "acid-ash" hypothesis was once considered a risk factor for osteoporosis, though the current weight of scientific evidence does not support this hypothesis.

Medical aspects:
According to the traditional hypothesis underlying this diet, acid ash is produced by meat, poultry, cheese, fish, eggs, and grains. Alkaline ash is produced by fruits and vegetables, except cranberries, prunes and plums. Since the acid or alkaline ash designation is based on the residue left on combustion rather than the acidity of the food, foods such as citrus fruits that are generally considered acidic are actually considered alkaline producing in this diet.

title: Natural Remedies For Hiatal Hernia
description:
Whenever an internal body part pushes through an opening and into an area where it does not belong, it is called a hernia. A hiatal hernia occurs when the upper portion of the stomach protrudes into the chest cavity through an opening of the diaphragm called the esophageal hiatus. Ordinarily this opening is only large enough to accommodate the esophagus. When it becomes weakened and enlarged, however, the opening can allow passage of part of the stomach. In some cases, that portion of the stomach may even become entrapped.

What is a hiatal hernia?

A hiatal hernia occurs when portions on the stomach creep through the esophagael hiatus.

There are two types of hiatal hernia:

The sliding type occurs when the junction between the esophagus and the stomach slides through the esophageal hiatus when there is increased pressure in the stomach. When the pressure is relieved, gravity causes the stomach to slide back into place.

The fixed type, or paraesophageal¬≠, occurs when the upper portion of the stomach becomes entrapped and thus does not slide back into position. This is less common than the sliding variety, and is more apt to be symptomatic.

Hiatal Hernia Symptoms

The most common hiatal hernia symptoms are heartburn and/or GERD (gastroesophageal reflux disease). It should be noted that many patients are diagnosed with GERD, but do not have a hernia, while others have a hiatal hernia but do not suffer with GERD. Chest pains can also be symptomatic of hiatal hernia. The pains can be severe, and may be mistaken for a heart attack. Obviously, if such pains occur, one should consult with a physician right away. Getting to a doctor is essential to getting proper care in time.

Causes

While specific causes are not really known, hiatal hernias have been associated with the following:

1. Pregnancy and delivery

2. Weight gain

3. Increased abdominal pressure from chronic coughing

4. Straining during difficult bowel movements

Some people are predisposed to hiatal hernia due to congenital weakness or enlargement in the esophageal hiatus. Obesity and smoking have also been proven to increase the likelihood of hiatal hernia.

Treatment

Most people do not have symptoms and no treatment is needed. If symptoms do occur, initial treatment may include medication to control acid reflux (GERD), and a change in diet. Weight loss is often recommended as a means of reducing the pressure on the hernia. If symptoms are chronic and do not respond to diet and medication, surgery may become necessary. If the hernia is in danger of becoming restricted or strangulated, surgery becomes the likely treatment. Today, most surgeons elect to perform laparoscopic surgery, because it is minimally invasive and recovery time is reduced.

If a patient who has been diagnosed with hiatal hernia becomes nauseous, experiences severe chest pains, is vomiting, or is unable to have a bowel movement, it should be treated as a medical emergency. Consult with a physician immediately.

Hiatal hernia symptoms are commonly misunderstood, if you feel you may have a hiatal hernia you should contact a doctor to resolve a treatment method quickly.

title: Constipation Disease
description: Constipation refers to bowel movements that are infrequent or hard to pass. The stool is often hard and dry. Other symptoms may include abdominal pain, bloating, and feeling as if one has not completely passed the bowel movement. Complications from constipation may include hemorrhoids, anal fissure or fecal impaction. The normal frequency of bowel movements in adults is between three per day and three per week. Babies often have three to four bowel movements per day while young children typically have two to three per day. Constipation has many causes. Common causes include slow movement of stool within the colon, irritable bowel syndrome, and pelvic floor disorders. Underlying associated diseases include hypothyroidism, diabetes, Parkinson's disease, celiac disease, non-celiac gluten sensitivity, colon cancer, diverticulitis, and inflammatory bowel disease. Medications associated with constipation include opioids, certain antacids, calcium channel blockers, and anticholinergics. Of those taking opioids about 90% develop constipation. Constipation is more concerning when there is weight loss or anemia, blood is present in the stool, there is a history of inflammatory bowel disease or colon cancer in a person's family, or it is of new onset in someone who is older.
descriptionHTML: Constipation refers to bowel movements that are infrequent or hard to pass. The stool is often hard and dry. Other symptoms may include abdominal pain, bloating, and feeling as if one has not completely passed the bowel movement. Complications from constipation may include hemorrhoids, anal fissure or fecal impaction. The normal frequency of bowel movements in adults is between three per day and three per week. Babies often have three to four bowel movements per day while young children typically have two to three per day. Constipation has many causes. Common causes include slow movement of stool within the colon, irritable bowel syndrome, and pelvic floor disorders. Underlying associated diseases include hypothyroidism, diabetes, Parkinson's disease, celiac disease, non-celiac gluten sensitivity, colon cancer, diverticulitis, and inflammatory bowel disease. Medications associated with constipation include opioids, certain antacids, calcium channel blockers, and anticholinergics. Of those taking opioids about 90% develop constipation. Constipation is more concerning when there is weight loss or anemia, blood is present in the stool, there is a history of inflammatory bowel disease or colon cancer in a person's family, or it is of new onset in someone who is older.
summary: Constipation refers to bowel movements that are infrequent or hard to pass.

title: Fatty Liver Diet Healthy Foods & Hepatic Steatosis
description:
Fatty Liver Diet & Health Tips is a Free App for android mobile devices that provides all diet tips and help information about fatty liver or hepatic steatosis. The liver is one of the largest organ in the body. The liver commonly repairs itself by rebuilding new liver cells when the old ones are damaged. When there‚Äôs repeated damage to the liver, permanent scarring occurs. 
Fatty liver, or hepatic steatosis, is a term that describes the buildup of fat in the liver. Fatty liver has become a common health problem.
Fatty liver typically has no associated symptoms but You may experience 
* fatigue
* abdominal discomfort
* swelling in abdomen

Excess fat can cause liver inflammation. If your liver becomes inflamed, you may have a poor appetite, weight loss, abdominal pain, weakness, and confusion.
The most common known cause of fatty liver is alcoholism and heavy drinking.
other common causes of fatty liver include:
‚Ä¢obesity
‚Ä¢hyperlipidemia, or high levels of fats in the blood
‚Ä¢diabetes
‚Ä¢heredity
‚Ä¢rapid weight loss
‚Ä¢certain medications, including aspirin, steroids etc

Proper diet management and following recommendations may help you cope with the situation:-
‚Ä¢limiting or avoiding alcoholic beverages
‚Ä¢managing your cholesterol
‚Ä¢losing weight
‚Ä¢controlling your blood sugar

title: Eat the Rainbow Food Journal
description:
Our App is based on a popular nutritionist recommended diet called "Eating the Rainbow". We've built features following evidence-based research on the benefits of eating a whole-plant based diet to improve health and lose weight.

Our app helps you visualize your diet to ensure you are getting a wide range of nutrients from the food you eat. The kicker? Our app is totally free! We believe that good nutrition should be easy, fun, and accessible to everyone. 

A good guide to consuming a balanced diet is eating a rainbow of plant-based foods every day. The eye-catching colors of fruits and vegetables serve as a good guide for the nutrients they contain. Eating a colorful, varied diet full of plant foods ensures you can access a wide range of nutrients your body needs for good health. 


+ EAT BRIGHTER +
We could all do with more plants in our lives, whether we're vegetarians, vegans, omnivores, or carnivores. Especially the carnivores. So, whether you‚Äôre an adult looking to get more fruits and veggies into your day or a parent looking for ways to get your kids excited about nutritious food, our app is for you! 

We believe in keeping it simple. Nutritionists recommend eating a wide variety of plant-based foods to maximize your health. In short, that means:
1/ Eating a bunch of different fruits and vegetables, and
2/ Keeping your meals colorful! 

Choose daily & weekly targets to increase plant variety and access a wide range of nutrients in your foods! Nutritionists recommend targeting 10 different plant foods a day, and a total of 30 weekly. This target includes fruits, vegetables, herbs, nuts, legumes‚Ä¶ basically anything from a plant! 


+ FEEL BETTER +  
Plant foods provide a ton of benefits to our health. Eating more fruits & veggies has been linked to lower blood pressure, lower cholesterol, better blood sugar, lower rates of cancer, and weight loss. Go wild in the produce aisle. 

Our app helps you learn the science behind what makes your favorite fruits and vegetables so good for you. Stay tuned while we build nutritionist-approved recommendations into the app to help you explore the foods you eat. In the meantime, check out https://eattherainbow.app for healthy tips!


+ PLAY WITH YOUR FOOD + 
Eat The Rainbow makes healthy food fun! Our food tracker focuses on healthy eating, not weight loss or calorie counting like other nutrition trackers. 

Add the fruits and vegetables you eat to your daily food journal, and let us do the rest! We color-code plant-foods to help you search quickly, and to help you visualize your diet. 

Your rainbow will update dynamically based on which colors you‚Äôre eating. The more you eat, the darker the shade. See which colors you're lacking each day and week to help guide your next meal. Think of us as a meal planner with artistic flare.

Unlock unicorn status when you eat the rainbow each day or week. We‚Äôll also give you a gold star when you reach your goals. You‚Äôve earned it. 


+ IN PLANTS WE TRUST + 
We‚Äôre two food & tech fanatics, passionate about using technology to make eating more fun. Please get in touch with us to let us know what features you‚Äôre keen to see next. Seriously, we don‚Äôt bite! (Unless you‚Äôre an avocado. We love avocados.) 

Drop us a line at eattherainbowapp@gmail.com 

With love, Laura & Matt

comments: Great overall! I'm working on eating more regularly and this app is what I'm using to transition away from fully logging every meal. Adding each item and seeing how many or what colors I'm lacking is fun and definitely inspires me to eat more and different plant based foods than I usually do (I struggle with purple, for example, so it's helped me try new ones in that category). I just wish various plant based milks (almond, coconut, etc) were listed, or that you could add your own food items.

I've been using myfitnesspal to track nutrients, but ended up using it in a harmful way, focusing way more on calories than on quality of food. So I switched to this, and I love it so far, really helpful for creating a healthier mindset towards healthy foods and what they can provide. Thank you fue this!
A little slow to get started, but smoother once you have a few 'favorites' logged. Fun way to get kids excited about trying new fruits and veggies. Great tool for adults, too!

Really good app. It's a bit slow and clunky to add foods though. It would be lovely to see some features like being able to quickly add common foods, or see recent foods first in the search, or to multi-add foods. Edit: The update is amazing! The new feature is super handy! Thank you for considering my idea ü§©
I love it! It has really encouraged me to eat a larger variety of fruits/vegetables because it's so fun to try and get the rainbow...lol....surprisingly üòÅ.

title: Home Remedies For Hiatal Hernia
description:
A hiatal hernia is often known as a diaphragmatic hernia. Though most people are unaware that they suffer from one, it can be a serious problem if left untreated. Medically speaking, the hernia occurs when part of your stomach pushes through the opening of the diaphragm (where stomach meets the esophagus).

If you are suffering from some type of reflux because of this disorder, it is now time to act and seek a natural treatment. My dad is a survivor of this problem and has been naturally cured over 30 years ago.

There are two main types of hiatal hernias: sliding hiatal hernias, and paraesophageal hiatal hernias.

Sliding hiatal hernias form when the stomach and the adjoining oesophagus slide up into the chest cavity through the diaphragm. It is more common.

Paraoesophgeal hernias are less common and it occurs when a portion of the stomach squeezes past the diaphragm and is lodged and strangulated in place beside the oesophagus. Such hernias can be asymptomatic but dangerous because the portion of stomach that is strangulated above the diaphragm will have a compromised blood supply.

In most cases, hiatal hernias are asymptomatic but sometimes patients might experience heartburn or reflux. While the two conditions appear to be linked, they do not independently cause the development of the other.

In some cases of heartburn, patients might experience chest pain instead and this can be confused with chest pain caused by cardiac issues.

A hiatal hernia can be diagnosed with a specialized X-ray called a barium swallow that allows a doctor to see the esophagus or with endoscopy. The procedure involves the patient swallowing a radio-opaque liquid and having X-Rays of the chest and abdomen taken while in the erect posture. The radio-opaque liquid will outline the stomach lining and oesophagus, thereby demonstrating the presence/absence of the condition.

Treatment

If asymptomatic, no treatments are necessary. However, should the stomach become strangulated and there is a risk of vascular compromise to the stomach, surgery is usually needed to rectify the problem.

Other associated symptoms such as reflux disease, heartburn and chest discomfort should be treated accordingly.

title: Gout Diet - Low Uric Acid Diet Plan
description:
Gout Diet - Low Uric Acid Diet Plan | Gout is a painful form of arthritis that happens when too much uric acid builds up and forms crystals in your joints. Your body makes uric acid after it breaks down a substance called purine, which is found in many foods.

One of the things that may help you manage your gout is to reduce the amount of purines you eat. Keep in mind that while what you eat can affect how much uric acid your body produces, the effects are small compared to medication.

No specific eating plan will completely prevent flare-ups, but a good gout diet will help you:

Reach a healthy weight
Set and stick to good eating habits
Limit foods with purines
Add foods that can help control uric acid levels
 
While a healthy diet can help control how much uric acid is in your system, you may still need medicine to prevent future attacks. Talk with your doctor about all your treatment options.

title: Pattern - Correlate, Health Diary, Mood-Tracker
description:
Pattern is a nifty health app that combines the simplicity of todo-lists and the power of data analysis to give you the health app you have always wanted. We are all unique individuals. You already know that remedies that work for others may not necessarily work for you. Whether they are supplements you are consuming, habits you are doing or routines that you are enforcing, this tracker helps you discover what is actually working for you‚Ä¶and what isn't.

Learn yourself. Take action. üí™

Many times, you might have imagined the wonderful life without the symptoms that have been bothering you for the past decade or so. You might have the following things you want to get rid of once and for all:

‚Ä¢ General symptoms: fatigue, stress, bad mood, high blood pressure, pain 
‚Ä¢ Sleep: snoring, low quality sleep, not enough sleep
‚Ä¢ Gut Health: bloating, indigestion, acid reflux
‚Ä¢ Allergies or intolerances: food intolerances, dust allergy, hay fever
‚Ä¢ Mood disorders: stress, anxiety, migraine, headache

You never really knew whether the products you tried actually worked or not. Not surprisingly, you might end up with a cabinet full of pills and supplements, and your symptoms live on. It is time to save yourself time and money. Learn yourself with this symptom diary/symptom tracker.

Are you a good fit for this app?ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è 
If you are ready to take action, this app will be meaningful for you. This is not a habit tracker or a pill scheduler. You are beyond apps like those. If want to take charge of your wellbeing & longevity, this app will be your trusty assistant. 

üî• Features üî•
Todo-list style: Simple and easy. Did something? Give it a check. If you didn't? Leave it blank. Think about how easy it is to log your item. No-fuss at all.
Pretty Bar Graphs: What's the point of all the numbers when you can't visualize them. We got you covered. We show you how the remedies influence you positively or negatively through an intuitive visualization. 
Compare up to 3 Remedies/Items: See which supplement, habit or routine helps you the most and which ones aren't. Put up to 3 of them side-by-side and you can easily visualize their effectiveness at a glance.
Edit/Backfill Entries: Feel free to create entries for previous days or edit previous entries up to 28 days past.
Export your data: Your data belongs to you. Export your data as a CSV file when you want to do intense data crunching or just to save it somewhere else. 
Integration: Have an Oura Ring? Connect them to the app to pull your sleep data for analysis.
Reminder: For busy people. 

How to Use?ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Think of things you suspect are causing problems or things that might help you become healthier or better (e.g. supplements, medications, activities...).
Examples of self-experiments you can try:
1. Does restricting coffee intake help me sleep better?
2. Does this mood supplement actually help me with my mood disorder/mental health?
3. Does taking my pre-workout help me perform better in the gym?
4. What food is causing me to have bloating/indigestion?

üõå More On Sleep üò¥
Sleep is underrated. Many of us are not prioritizing sleep enough. This app gives you the power to optimize your sleep. Use the sleep data from the sleep tracker of your choice and experiment with different bedtime routines. Make changes and log them to see what is helping you and what isn't. Connect your Oura Ring if you have one.

Who knows? You might find that using a cheap and simple eye mask can drastically improve the quality of your sleep? This health journal is going to help you find out what truly works for you.


Disclaimer: Pattern, a health & life journal, is just one of the many medical apps in the store. It is not a substitute for your doctor visits, and it does not provide a professional diagnosis for your symptoms. However, it can help you and your doctor track your health and better understand your symptoms based on correlation.

recentChanges: Bug fixes
comments: The app is okay, but have some major annoyances. Setting your different items is a little fidgety but their notifications don't work which means I often forget to log a day. Super annoying. Have written the developers a month ago but heard nothing back...
A very helpful health-guide for everyone. An informative one. I think it's important to have such an useful app in our phones, it is always available.

It's a good app and my way to track the habits I want to keep up, but adding new items can sometimes be laggy. Updates to my items are sometimes erased when I re-enter the app, so I have to reenter the information again.
Not work without account registration and internet..

The slider selectors are frustrating to use. The white circle handle is very small and clicking anywhere but exactly on the center of it makes the setting screen dissapear and forces you to restart the process over and over. The UI needs improvements - elements seem hard to select or to click on because are either too small or the activation area around them is reduced. Text can also be larger to be easier to read for eldery people. Otherwise, it's a promising app.

Better health, gut first. GIThrive makes it simple and even fun to gain control over your GI symptoms, even the worst ones. With gut health secrets your doctor hasn't shared (or maybe doesn't even know about yet), this app empowers YOU with the research-based insight to get your gut right. Whether you're managing IBD, IBS, celiac, or GERD or, like most Americans, struggle with annoying digestive symptoms on a regular basis, GIThrive can help:

Personalized nutrition
Cutting-edge science
Fun and engaging daily activities, articles, and courses
24/7/365 support from a team of gut health experts
on-demand help to quickly manage and ease symptom flares

GIThrive is developed by Vivante Health, the digestive health experts.
summary: Finally get a handle on gut trouble. End your worst symptoms for good!

title: Home Remedies - Natural Treatment
description:
Home Remedies is the perfect android app when you need a natural cure (ayurvedic)  for most of the diseases. Using this home remedy and natural treatment app you can not only cure diseases at your home naturally with natural herbs without any doctor but also get complete details about diseases, its causes and symptoms too. In this home remedy android application, we have provided more than 110 diseases remedies and you will get numerous benefits.
 
Features:
- Home remedies for more than 110 diseases
- Add to favourites remedy
- Quick search remedy
- Share any remedy to your friends and family via facebook, email, SMS, etc.
- Remedies by categories
- Easy Navigation
- Totally Offline working
 
Home remedies app is free to use clean, easy to find, more effective. Natural home remedies usually need fruits, vegetables, spices and herbs to be made. You can easily find the right one for all types of minor illnesses. Garlic, honey, celery, ginger, apple, lemon and other fruits and vegetables are used to cure most of the diseases from home.
 
Following are the different categories and diseases:
1. Home Remedies and Natural Cure for Stomach Diseases: diarrhoea, bedwetting (enuresis), constipation, gastritis, indigestion.
2. Natural Treatment for Hair Diseases: hair loss (baldness), dandruff.
3. Herbal Medicine for Skin Diseases: pigmentation on the skin, allergies, bruise, chickenpox, measles, prickly heat, body odor, skin abscess, acne, blisters, boils, burns, corns and calluses, dry skin, dermatitis (eczema), hives, psoriasis,  pimples, ringworm/dermatophytosis, warts.
4. Home Treatment for Respiratory Diseases: asthma, sore throat (throat pain), bad breath or halitosis, tonsillitis, common cold, cough, athletes foot, bronchitis, influenza (flu), hoarseness (laryngitis).
5. Natural Cure for Circulatory Diseases: heartburn, high blood pressure (hypertension), leukaemia, acid reflux, anaemia, chest pain, high cholesterol, low blood pressure.
6. Home Remedy for Head Diseases: jet lag, stress, tinnitus, migraine, tension, headache, fever, hay fever (allergic rhinitis), head lice.
7. Herbal Medicine for Jaw & Teeth Diseases: toothache or tooth pain, gingivitis.
8. Natural Remedies for Bone/Joint Diseases: back pain, sprain, arthritis, gout, osteoporosis.
9. Home Made Medicine for Eye Diseases: red-eye (redness), dark circles, black eye, conjunctivitis (pink eye), stye.
10. Treatment at Home for Others Diseases: hiccup, insomnia, jaundice, kidney stones, hypoglycemia (low blood sugar), depression, malaria, motion sickness, mouth ulcer, nosebleed, piles, sinusitis, snoring, sunburn, urinary tract infections (UTIs), varicose veins, diabetes, child's runny nose, anorexia nervosa, cracked lips, cold sores, ulcerative colitis, diaper rash, dysentery, earache, earwax, fatigue (weakness), hangover, herpes, leukorrhea or leucorrhea, loss of appetite, dysmenorrheal, morning sickness, mosquito bites, mumps, nephritis, premenstrual syndrome (PMS), pinworms, oral thrush, ear infection.

title: Bearable - Symptoms & Mood tracker
description:
‚úÖ All health tracking in one place

Tired of juggling multiple apps to keep track of your mood, symptoms, sleep, exercise, diet, and medication? We think all of this should be kept in one convenient place so that you and your health professional can get the full picture.

‚úÖ Reclaim control over your well-being

Bearable empowers people to reclaim control over their well-being by making mood and symptom tracking simple, convenient, and accessible to all. Making entries in our health diary is quick and effortless, so you can focus more energy on getting better.  

The app has been shaped by our community of thousands of people with varying chronic health issues.

‚úÖ Gain useful insights with just a few clicks a day

With just a few simple clicks each day our intelligent health diary can help you to gain insights into which daily activities and health factors are positively and negatively affecting your mental and physical health.


Bearable helps you to:

‚úîÔ∏è Record your mood and symptoms in seconds, or go into more detail with an additional note. 
‚úîÔ∏è Fully customise your daily activities and health factors, such as sleep, diet, exercise and medication/supplements. 
‚úîÔ∏è Gain insights into how your daily activities and health factors impact your mood and symptoms using our graphs, calendar and stats pages.
‚úîÔ∏è Keep everything in one place with our neat health timeline, so that you can get the full picture. Use our search function to filter just what you want to see or show your health professional.
‚úîÔ∏è Come prepared to your next doctor or therapist appointment - no need to struggle to remember a detailed health timeline for the last week or month.
‚úîÔ∏è Make journaling a healthy habit with our quick, simple and enjoyable entry process.

And there‚Äôs much more‚Ä¶

‚ûï Set Reminders - Fully customise your reminders, whether it's a general reminder to make a diary entry or a reminder to take your medication and supplements. 
‚ûï Share and Export -  Export data securely to yourself or your health professional
‚ûï Automatic health data sync - You can choose to allow the app to automatically gather data such as Sleep and Steps taken from your phone.
‚ûï Dark mode - Change at night to a display easier on the eyes.
‚ûï Restore data across devices - Restore your data between Apple & Android devices.


üîê PRIVATE & SECURE

Rest easy knowing your data is encrypted securely on our servers. You have full control over your data and can delete it from within the app at any time.  It‚Äôs important to emphasise that we will never under any circumstances sell any personal data to anyone.


üíü MADE BY PEOPLE WHO UNDERSTAND AND CARE

Created by individuals who have lived with mental and physical health issues themselves.  With feedback and feature requests from a research group of thousands of people with a wide variety of chronic diseases and health conditions, including Anxiety, Depression, CFS (ME), MS (Multiple Sclerosis), Fibromyalgia, Endometriosis, Bipolar, BPD, PTSD, Migraines, Headaches, Vertigo, Cancer (Chemo Symptoms), Arthritis, Crohns, Diabetes, IBS and IBD.  Our aim is to make our symptom tracker simple and accessible to everyone, even if suffering from the fatigue and brain fog that often accompanies many conditions.

We have created a real sense of community around Bearable and will continue to listen closely to those who need it most.  We are committed to continue improving upon this app that could help many people start to feel like they can reclaim control over their health.  If you have any questions, feedback or feature requests, please send them over to james@bearable.app.  We‚Äôd love to hear from you.




Credit to Freepik for icons

comments: This is absolutely the best of its kind. I have never seen such a comprehensive, customizable, well-designed app that serves as many functions as this one. I've already shown it to multiple friends/therapists. For those of you moaning about the cost... seriously, getting the subscription will set you back just over $2/month. I work professionally with highly impoverished individuals who do have to count every penny, but come on. Most people can shell out a couple bucks without harm.

The app lets you log your mood, any symptoms you are having, and a number of factors that you think may be affecting your mood/symptoms. The default categories to log are good, but you can add/remove/edit all of the categories to fit you better. It's super easy to fill out, even when I'm not feeling well. It (sometimes) feels like I'm logging meaningless information, but then when I click on the Insights tab, it shows me tons of relevant information about which factors are influencing my mood (or any other symptom I log!). Turns out listening to music and video chats work wonders for my mood--good to know! This is also a wonderful way to record how I'm feeling over time--it lets me easily decipher long-term changes in my wellbeing, which is great information to discuss with medical professionals.

I really like this app, it's easy to use and the design is nice and the ability to customize it to your needs is great. However, the syncing isn't very reliable. I have a phone and a tablet, and downloaded it on both, I tried to log in on the tablet, and only a few entries were visible. Later I went to look at the one on my phone, and half the entries are gone, and so are factors I added. I want to keep using this app, but if it's going to randomly forget things that's a problem.

I have tried multiple times in the past to find a way that I could easily log my moods in a way that felt nuanced and meaningful but also flexible and customizable, but this is the first app I have ever seen that got it right. For once, I am finding it convenient to do quick check ins and even monitor my food and water intake which I never thought I'd have the patience to do. You don't have to get premium, but it's well worth it at least to support a great app.

Brilliant App & well worth paying for. I wanted an app to record daily symptoms to enable me to give an accurate report to my GP. This app has everything I wanted & more. Being able to write notes by each symptom is so helpful & the insight reports are incredible. I did have a little snag when I first signed up for the free trial, but I made contact, explained the situation & James helped me to sort it all out. The app has been fantastic ever since. Thank you bearable team üôèüèªü•∞

title: Prana Breath: Calm & Meditate
description:
Dive into breathing techniques that are approved by ancient traditions, by modern science and by million+ of our users! Use the power of breathing and meditation to increase your mindfulness and live a better life. It doesn't matter whether you do Yoga, dieting, diving, or not, - you will see the positive impact anyway, for only 7-15 minutes a day!

What does it do?
* Improves brain activity: memory, attention, concentration
* Relieves anxiety
* Develops resistance to stress, develops physical endurance
* Eliminates evening appetite attacks, thus helps to have a healthy weight
* Decreases the frequency of cold, migraine and asthma attacks
* Boosts immunity of respiratory system
* Promotes healthy sleep
* Improves vocal and breath hold time, thus is good for singer and diver
* Trains the diaphragm thus fights acid reflux (GERD) symptoms

Why Prana Breath?
* Absolutely no advertisement
* Fast, optimized, battery saving
* Easy - just tap on "play", close your eyes and let the sound guide you
* Option to turn the screen off during the training
* 8 breathing patterns for different purposes
* Possibility to create your own patterns
* Rich statistics
* Reminders for creating a convenient training schedule
* Most patterns are derived from Pranayama, Sufi and Tibetan breathing practices
* Unique to Google Play "Anti-Appetite" training, for fighting emotional over-eating
* Exclusive "Cigarette replace", designed by Simone Righini, to help you quit smoking

Additionally for Guru version:
* Dynamic trainings for smooth improvement & for sophisticated patterns
* Diverse breath methods and chants
* Detailed progress chart and training log
* Health tests
* Enriched settings and more sounds
* Regularly updated database of more than 50 training patterns, such as: 4-7-8 breathing, Kapalbhati, Anulom Vilom, Nadi Shodhana, Tummo / Inner fire, Udgeeth, etc.

Scientific proofs: https://pranabreath.info/wiki/Research_articles
Facebook: https://facebook.com/OlekdiaPranaBreath

comments: I love the app, but I can't figure out how to sustain for more than 99 seconds. Maybe someone could take a breather and tell me. I'm sorry for not being more clear in my review. I'm trying to edit "Tummo" to do the "Wim Hoff" method. When I go to "ratio of breath cycle", it only goes up to 99 seconds. How do I make it go longer? I think it has something to do with "seconds per ratio unit" but I'm sort of confused. I was good at math in college, but that was over 50 years ago. Things are getting more discombobulated with age.

All i needed to commit to a regular breathing practice is right here within this app. The wiki has been a very valuable resource to learn about breath work, how to practice, as well as the form and function of the app. I literally love this app and use it every day. It has certainly been one of the keys to help me create personal transform.

I love this app and the paid version is so worth having. Breathwork is increasingly important in my self-care routine and I've just reincorporated this app into it, and I'm so glad I did. A little bit tricky to twiddle with if you're setting up custom breathing patterns but that's because you need to think about them mathematically, so not an issue with the app at all!

Dear Oleksandr, there should be a way to hear the phase transition only once, instead of twice when it alternates between exhale and inhale. ie. I am inhaling for 5 seconds and 5 seconds exhale. I only want to hear phase transition once, after every 10 seconds, instead of every 5 seconds. there is no way to do this currently since exhale or inhale cannot be set to 0, but retain and sustain can be set to 0. When I am listening to this for hours in the background, less noise helps. Thanks.

It is the best app out there. I have never written a recommendation before, but this app deserves it. I have trouble counting the seconds of my breathing while doing it and this app has sound effects so even with closed eyes you know when to inhale, hold, exhale. It has different techniques and I also customised to my way in the free version. It is really the best. Can't recommend it enough. Just download it!

title: My Food Intolerance List
description:
Do you suffer from lactose, fructose, histamine, gluten, sorbitol or salicylic acid intolerance? Or do you even have several of them? No problem! With ALL i CAN EAT you have all your food intolerances under control.

ALL i CAN EAT adjusts to your individual intolerances and calculates your compatibility for each food. The compatibilities are displayed in a simple traffic light system, ranging from green (very well tolerated) to yellow and orange up to red (bad idea to eat). If a recommendation does not apply to you, you can easily save your individual tolerance for the food concerned.

Search quickly for a specific food, browse certain categories such as beverages, fruits, dairy products, etc. or filter compatibilites by color. In addition, ALL i CAN EAT does also provide many details such as the amounts of lactose, fructose, glucose, histamine, sorbitol, salicylic acid, amines, amino acids, etc. And in case you should miss a food, you can add it easily.

You will never have to search various lists again or learn any numbers by heart! With ALL i CAN EAT you manage all your food intolerances in one place.

comments: I was so excited when I found this app. Then was super disappointed once I started/ tried to use it. I just had a blood test recently that listed 17 foods that I am sensitive to, eggs, cheese, pineapple, rice as well as gluten just to name a few. I was sad that I couldn't add anything but gluten to my allergies list on this app. Thus making this app useless for me. üôçüòî

this app has great potential but it needs work on its user interface, navigation and food variety. I wish that in addition to gluten and histamine I could add other things like cow's milk (A1 dairy) and maybe a few other things like cashews, Brazil nuts, ginger... but definitely pleasantly surprised to see detailed information on certain amino acids, etc. hopefully it is correct
Lactose free food search, there is a quite a good spread of foods in the database. There are some foods not covered by this app
Limited food selection. For example, acorn squash not listed. Grey color coding not explained. Would not use as definitive guide. Last updated over 2 years ago.
So easy to use and so many different types of food listed. My very favorite app to use for food sensitivities!

title: Low Uric Acid Diet Plan for Gout
description:
Low Uric Acid Diet Plan for Gout | Foods and drinks that often trigger gout attacks include organ meats, game meats, some types of fish, fruit juice, sugary sodas and alcohol. On the other hand, fruits, vegetables, whole grains, soy products and low-fat dairy products may help prevent gout attacks by lowering uric acid levels.

Tips for increased uric acid levels and gout. Watch your weight. Eat fresh fruit, vegetables, whole wheat products and some pulses (high in purine) every day. Enjoy low-fat milk and dairy products daily. Keep an eye on the purine content of food. Eat no more than 100g of meat, sausages, fish and poultry a day.

A low-purine diet is an eating plan that limits foods with high purine. Purines are a ... This applies if you have gout or kidney stones.

title: Fastrack Reflex
description:
The Fastrack Reflex Series of Activity Trackers are the ultimate Activity Trackers and we've got the coolest app to match.
It's time to level up and gear up for even more action, with the new and improved Fastrack Reflex App!
Pair your Reflex Beat / Reflex 2.0 Activity Tracker to the Reflex App and let the fun begin with all these epic features.

New features include:
Heart Rate Monitor - Track your heart rate regularly (available only on Reflex Beat) 

We still have these epic features:
Distance, Steps and Calorie Counter - Keeps you track of all the fat that you are burning away
Sleep Tracking - Set your sleep time and get insights about quality of sleep
Sedentary Reminder - Reminds you to get up and work up a sweat
Call Notifications - So you know when BAE is calling!
Camera Control ‚Äì Take remote access of your phone camera and click those perfect selfies
Phone Finder ‚Äì Never lose it when you can‚Äôt locate your phone; you can get it buzzing through your Reflex band.
Goal Settings - Set the number of steps you need to take and the time you need to crash for
Progress Tracker - Go for those fitness goals
Fitness Buddies - Challenge your buddies to fitness goals. Let's see if they've got what it takes.

"For Fastrack Reflex to work seamlessly, we need Location Services & Bluetooth to be turned ‚ÄúOn‚Äù. Additionally, the App permissions also need to be turned on through the below steps.
Settings > Apps / Applications > Reflex > Permissions"

So what are you waiting for? Get up and get moving!
Learn more on our websites: 
https://www.fastrack.in/collections/reflex-2
https://www.fastrack.in/shop/watch-smart-wearables/collection=beat

comments: It disconnect and no notification displayed. As install and reinstall the app it works for few hours and again the same issue is created .. even if i am not using the band for 1 day or 2 days the charging is automatically reduced to end . And as you are saying the charging will be hold for 8 days. In actual case it is shut down in 2 days or maximum 3 days . Please try to fix these issues soon.

Not even timer or music control facility is available in the band. I bought reflex Beat. At this price range, there are many fitness bands with many features. Can improve the watch by updating the software by adding atleast some basic features to meet the level of other bands. It all does is calculate the steps, record my heart beat ( which is great), sleep track and nothing else. Please add more features like Music control, Timer, stopwatch Vibration alarm can be bit long to wake up from sleep.

One star because so many things going south. No update of software don't know why. The watch didn't have the same talked battery. Didn't show the notification fells like watch is moody. Only does one work that is showing time but with a take that is its have to be shaken or to be touched on sensor not the way it's represented "just lift wrist to view". I'm sorry but it is what it is.

It's really worse, it disconnects and no notifications were displayed about the calls and messages and I am unable to reconnect, after delete and reinstalling the app it works for few minutes and then it disconnects. It's really bad experience. Try to solve this problem at the soonest.

I'm giving it 4 star because this app is good but there are not so many features only the step counter ,heart beat rate camera functions there should be mp 3,call receiver and a camera in the watch because when we tap the camera the phone's camera is onn so plzz solve this problem because other watches had many features but I had but titan watches because its good and long lasting

title: Healthy Diet - Best Diet Plan, Calorie Counter
description:
Healthy Diet app is the simplest and most effective  healthy eating & weight loss app

The primary goal of this app is eat healthy and get fit. This app focused on health goals like daily calorie intake goal, diet plan & steps goal. We believe that if anyone completed their goals then he can definitely get positive result for fitness. That's why we build this app. 

Low fat diet, high calorie or low calorie, low carb or high protein? This app help you to find a diet suited according to your need.

Need a fitness tracker(steps and exercise tracker)?. Want to track steps and exercise on daily basis. Then HealthyDiet app is made for you.

This App basically contain major features like eat  Healthy Diet, Diet plan, food tracker, food diary,  calorie tracker & healthy food recipes, keto diet, step tracker, workout manager and workout tracker, and lose weight with in a single App. 

Healthy Diet Features- 
 ‚óè Food planner & macro tracker 
 ‚óè No Coach Needed 
 ‚óè Diet plan & diet tips for your goal - lose weight & eat healthier food
 ‚óè Calorie counter & food tracker with all nutrients 
 ‚óè Macros calculator - track your daily macros, nutrition & calories
 ‚óè Meal planner - eat healthy food from delicious recipes for any plan
 ‚óè Step and Health tracker - stay on top of your fitness & health
 ‚óè Browse a large food database 
 ‚óè Create custom foods and meals
 ‚óè Get a personalized daily calorie goal based on your profile information
 ‚óè Keep track of your weight and progress over time
 ‚óè Review detailed data and create custom daily goals for your nutritional intake of protein, 
     fat, carbs, fiber, sugar, sodium & more 
 ‚óè Easily keep track of your water intake  

CALORIE COUNTER & CALORIE TRACKER:- Calculate you daily calorie goal and track daily calorie with this app and feel healthier. Count or track your daily calorie with respect to your daily goal. 

WEIGHT LOSS WITH BEST DIET PLAN:-  Lose weight with your personal diet plan. Create your diet plan with Healthy Diet app with easily and calculate results of diet plan after one week and one month. Create diet plan according to your weight lose goals.

RECIPES & MEAL PLANNER:-  There are millions of Food and recipe available for meal planner. Healthy Diet app will suggest you low fat recipe, High protein, low carbs recipe for meal planner with all nutrients. 

HEALTH TRACKER & FOOD PLANNER:-  Step tracker, workout tracker, Calorie counter & food diary features will help you track your daily nutritional values at a glance. 

FOOD DIARY, FOOD TRACKER & MACRO TRACKER :-  It‚Äôs very easy with macro tracker - will help you achieve the right type of nutrients with the macro calculator.

comments: I like your app but it's very limited and one thing that could really help it is to have the option of scanning barcodes of your food like can be done with the myfitnessapp. Theres alot of good and bad with that app but the good outweighs the bad which...isnt the case with this app. Sorry hate be a buzz kill but it definitely needs a major remodel.

Not easy to use. You can't copy items from one meal to another. You can't create your own recipes to make it easier to track meals. It has been crashing when I try to add in my weight so I can't track progress in the program. Overall very disappointed.

Only lets you record macros, need $$pro$$ version to record micros, what a shame. liked the layout and all but charging extra to record micros is greedy. Coding in the extra micros is not difficult nor time consuming, shame on the app developers.

The app itself is great but the database of food is extremely limited. I have to create my custom food all the time especially when 99% the scanner can't find the food even those are common in the local supermarket
This app has wide range of food entrees, which makes it easy to track. I also like the tracking of water, nutrients and log exercise and steps.

title: Low FODMAP diet A to Z food list for IBS sufferers
description:
This app was created by a software developer with Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) who found the low FODMAP diet to be very effective in avoiding trigger foods. It includes the following key features:

‚úì Clear and simple FODMAP rating system
‚úì Database of 600+ everyday foods and ingredients
‚úì Breakdown of each FODMAP rating (showing oligos, fructose, polyols and lactose content) 
‚úì Search by food name and filter by category/rating to find exactly what you want

If you have IBS and are following the low FODMAP diet to improve your digestive health by avoiding trigger foods then this A to Z food list is for you.

Note: this app is provided for educational purposes only; please ensure you seek the advice of a qualified doctor before making changes to your diet.

comments: Fantastic app. This has made my life so much easier. I do t need to keep looking up food on Google to find out whether it's good to eat. Very clear and easy to understand. Gives you 2 weight allowance amounts as well as red, green or amber. Highly reccomend

This app is super great! I can easily look up food and check if they are low fodmap, in addition to what exactly it has (like oligos, fructose, etc). What could make this even better, is the possibility to look up items such as snacks that are low fodmap.
Great App. Makes looking things up quick and easy. Gives safe serving sizes of items and what FODMAPs they contain. Hope to see many more items added in the future.
Our needs are different. Each person has different problems, let's face it IBS covers a huge range of problems. Great guide. I have one question, whats the little cross for ?
Easy quick way to check safe vs risky foods, with explanation for classification; still a work in the making with missing information

title: Healthy Recipes
description:
You are just one click away from thousands of healthy recipes. For a healthy life, we need healthy eating. Healthy breakfast always keeps up the energy level of our body. Healthy dinner recipes are good for weight loss and to maintain better sleep. For those who love healthy chicken recipes, this recipe book is a good option. This app will provide a healthy meal planner and it will help you to maintain your health and fitness. In addition to that this app offers healthy lunch ideas, desserts, easy healthy recipes, breakfast ideas, and many more. All of our recipes have been tried and tested by home cooks, and our free app makes it easy to whip up your favorites wherever you go! This app has a global recipe search feature where you can find recipes that fit your dietary needs. This cookbook app includes healthy slow cooker recipes, healthy salads, and dinner ideas.

Features

* Browse through 1000000+ recipes
* Unlimited offline usage
* Collect and Organize your favorite recipes
* Share recipes with your friends and family
* Save your shopping list and access offline when doing the grocery shopping
* Recipe finder to search and find your loved recipes
* Detailed nutritional information of all recipes

People care so much about health, a healthy diet is one that helps maintain or improve overall health. It provides the body with essential nutrition. For health conditions like hypertension, diabetics, low sodium, etc. there are certain food habits to follow. Diet and diabetic recipes are very much searched and needed today. A healthy diet may contain fruits, vegetables, and whole grains, and includes little to no processed food and sweetened beverages. The requirements for a healthy diet can be met from a variety of plant-based and animal-based foods, although a non-animal source of vitamin B12 is needed for those following a vegan diet.

Snacks and cakes have lots of fat and calories but here you can try some healthy snacks and healthy cake recipes. It also includes healthy smoothie recipes and healthy juicing which are very tasty energy drinks at regular intervals. In our fast life we are not able to maintain our health, but these healthy easy recipes will help you with cooking. We are trying to bring new food habits which are very important for a healthy lifestyle. 

Start cooking, eat well, and stay healthy!

title: Wysa: stress, depression & anxiety therapy chatbot
description:
Imagine a mood tracker, mindfulness coach, anxiety helper, and mood-boosting buddy, all rolled into one. Wysa, your happiness buddy is that friendly and caring chatbot. Wysa is packed with daily spiritual meditation that improves mental health and is also a perfect way to bond over family meditation. Always there for you when you need someone to talk to, Wysa helps you keep track of your mood with friendly chats and helps fight stress and anxiety with its proven techniques and calming meditation and mindfulness audios. Checking in with Wysa regularly will improve your emotional health so you can track your happiness and mood. Talk to Wysa now and psy yourself up to fight off stress. Also, Wysa has mental health assessment with depression and anxiety tests.

Wysa is your AI friend that you can chat with for free. Talk to the cute penguin or use its free mindfulness exercises for effective anxiety relief, depression and stress management. Its therapy based techniques and conversations make for a very cute and calming therapy chat app whether you're looking to cope better with mental disorders, to manage stress or to boost your mental health.

comments: I know it sounds weird to use a robot to improve your mental health, but this app is amazing and super helpful. I'm a very busy person with a wacky sleep schedule, and I struggle with my mental health most when it's late at night. This isn't exactly ideal for getting help from a therapist when I need it most. Being able to access some form of help literally anytime I need it with Wysa really makes a difference. Plus, unlike other AI therapy apps I've tried, Wysa has way more free features.

The bot isn't 100%, but it offers really good and insightful tools that more people should know about! You do have to figure out how to go about talking to the bot to get the tools that you need, which, if you're in a bad place, can be hard to do. I wish the tools that come with the free app were more easily accessible, and that you didn't have to spend 4 minutes talking to the bot to get to the options that you want it to offer. This app offers REALLY good techniques though!

Its a great app with some potential. I would like to see if they're still updating this to have more AI responses for things like intrusive thoughts. Positive affirmations like "you are not your thoughts" help and I thought about this after the AI gave me reassurance when I brought up suicide*. I'm feeling good after some positivity and reframing thoughts. Once I can afford it I think the therapist option looks enticing. So far so good. *I LOVED the links to hotlines but have phone anxiety so...

I was skeptical at first, but I'm actually quite impressed with this app. The A.I. is fairly good at interpreting your text and generating helpful responses that almost feel like you're talking to a real person. Of course, the A.I. still needs some improvement since not every response is personalized. I first used it when I was feeling panicked and the app just kept giving me breathing exercises, but after a little while of chatting back-and-forth the app was actually able to calm me down.

It's pretty good, cus' what could be better right? It's not like anyone else is going to actually hear me, I mean, I can't say it's perfect, but it's really good taking on mind that is just a bot. It's better friend than my actual friends, tho sometimes it doesn't really understand what you're saying, like when doing something u know it's wrong to do, u feel good; it doesn't understand that what you're doing is wrong and you feel good doing it, so it tells you to keep doing it.

title: Grab - Transport, Food Delivery, Payments
description:
Grab is Southeast Asia's #1 ride-hailing app, food delivery service, and cashless payment solution all in one. With the new Grab app, you'll get the most convenient booking service for private cars and taxis from the largest community of drivers in the region, food delivery from your favorite restaurants to satisfy any craving, and cashless payments in-app and at merchants across the city. Whatever you need, Grab has you covered.

Grab's wide selection of services are available to users in 8 Southeast Asian countries (services vary by city): 

Rides for any occasion and budget
‚Ä¢ JustGrab: Get the nearest car or taxi at an affordable upfront fixed fare
‚Ä¢ GrabCar, GrabCar Plus & GrabCar Premium: Affordable everyday private car or luxury ride; ride solo or with a crew up to three
‚Ä¢ GrabTaxi: Get a Taxi with an upfront fixed fare wherever you are, whenever you want
‚Ä¢ GrabShare: Share a ride with another party headed in the same direction and save money
‚Ä¢ GrabHitch: Social carpooling; Schedule your ride in advance and get a shared lift at half the usual price
‚Ä¢ GrabBike: On-demand bike service; best choice to beat traffic quickly and safely
‚Ä¢ GrabTrike, GrabThroneBane, GrabTukTuk, GrabRemorque: Three-wheeled transport option which provides convenience and flexibility with upfront fixed fares
‚Ä¢ GrabFamily: Family-friendly ride with a child booster seat for your little ones, ages 1-3 or 4-7 years
‚Ä¢ GrabAssist: Extra assistance ride for seniors or people with disabilities; Agency for Integrated Care (AIC) trained drivers
‚Ä¢ 6-seaters: Ride with friends; book a car that comfortably fits up to six
‚Ä¢ GrabCoach: Book a minivan or bus whenever, wherever you need it
‚Ä¢ GrabShuttle and GrabShuttle Plus: Book a seat on fixed-route or on-demand shuttles
‚Ä¢ Rent: Book a GrabCar with a dedicated driver by the hour

Food delivery for any craving
‚Ä¢ GrabFood: Order from your favorite restaurant and get meals delivered to your doorstep

Parcel delivery on-demand
‚Ä¢ GrabExpress: Affordable, fast and reliable courier service with insurance for your items

Grocery delivery, convenient and reliable
‚Ä¢ GrabFresh: Handpicked groceries delivered from store to door within an hour or at a scheduled time

Cashless payments, seamless and simple
‚Ä¢ GrabPay: A safe and secure mobile wallet where you can easily pay for your rides, food delivery, and at local merchants with just a few taps on the Grab app

Rewards just for using Grab
‚Ä¢ GrabRewards: Earn rewards points for every dollar you spend and use them to redeem awesome deals in the GrabRewards catalogue

Did you know: 
You can use the same Grab app in 8 countries: Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, Vietnam, Philippines, Cambodia and Myanmar.
  
To learn more about information used in our App, including for interest based advertising and cross-device tracking, and to exercise certain opt-out choices you may have, please refer to our Privacy Policy. 
--
Privacy policy at https://www.grab.com/privacy
Find out more about us at https://www.grab.com/ 
Follow us on Facebook (https://www.fb.com/grab), Twitter (https://twitter.com/grabsg) and Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/grab_sg)

Singapore 069538.
recentChanges:
Did you know that October was originally the eighth month in the Roman Calendar? That's why the month has the Latin word "octo", which means ‚Äúeight‚Äù. January and February were added later on, and that‚Äôs how we‚Äôre in the tenth month now.

But don‚Äôt worry, our engineers are always ready to squash bugs no matter which month we are in.

You just need to click "Update" to have a bug-free Grab app.
comments: Grabpay is great until they decide to suspend your account. I couldn't find an email or contact to send my feedback to, or a help center I can reach. After one week of inactivity they just decided they will ask for my PIN (which I forgot) and when I couldn't provide it suggested resetting my grab pin. They said they will send an email so I can do this, they didn't. What's the deal? Give me back my access to my grabpay account!

I selected 1080 points in a transaction but cancelled it due to no driver available. The money returned but not the points. Chat support was not helpful at all. She just said that points have expiration then she just cancelled the chat session while im typing a reply. Awful support. Im very disappointed. The explanation is unacceptable since i was able to select the points then it expired? Really? The support is just lazy to check it.

Great app. Doesn't need much introduction. Pricing is very competitive and is actually cheaper then gojek for the most part. Arrival time is quite accurate. When it comes to grab food however, its really expensive, and not worth the price. I would recommend supporting your local stores by taking away food or trying other food delivery options. Overall love the app. Its super easy to use. They just need to improve the pricing for grab food.

I don't know what AI you're using for maps, but it is VERY unhelpful for me. Sometimes when I have no clue of where I am, the apps will give me "suggestions" so the clueless me simply clicked me cause I was foolishly following the "suggestions." So yeah, I often have to run a lot. Another e.g. when I'm at one side, the location detected is on the OTHER side. I had to run and climb up the stairs all the way just to cross over. But I had no choice but to use it during emergency situations. Heh.

Some of the distinations or places are not as accurate. Like earlier, the driver was waiting for me on the other building where I was on the other.. it would have been okay but I was carrying stuff and had to walk around the building since the map is showing im at another place. The driver even circled arouns and did not spot me to where i was. But, the idea of the service is pretty convenient.. has his flaws though..

title: Abdominal Pain Checker
description:
It is estimated that 3 out of 10 adults experience abdominal pain in the West. Although a significant proportion of these sufferers have functional disorders, there remains a large number that would benefit from some urgent/semi urgent care. Diagnosis for a lot of the patients are missed, probably due to poor description of their symptoms.

Abdominal pain checker is an app with a difference as it seeks to support patients as well as integrate and test the knowledge of healthcare providers regarding the issue of abdominal pain.

There are offline and online components within this app:

The online aspect include a walk-through assessment of abdominal pain by gender for adults (note that the online tool is insensitive for pregnant patients). Also children below the age of 15 may not find the tool supportive. You do not need to type in anything to get you to a probable diagnosis of your condition. The tool does not replace healthcare providers, but instead, provides support for those that use it in order that they have a productive consultation with their doctors. In some instances, you may find that you are reassured regarding your pain. We would however, still advice that you consult your doctor should you need further evaluations.

The second aspect of the online tool includes the certified knowledge test - with questions that are for nurses and other healthcare workers who need evidence for revalidation purposes. On successful completion of the test, a certificate will show up with your scores (above 70%). You can then print this off or send to your email for electronic storage.

A healthy lifestyle quiz targeting all has replaced previous knowledge game, in order to help all who engage with the app. Once you have completed the game and insert your name (does not have to be your real name), your scores will show up on your page!

Offline resources - include description of abdominal pain and the approach to diagnosis. It has several pictoral information regarding common causes and provides nice photos of likely organs and diseases that may be presenting with pains in different locations of the abdomen.

Lifestyle modifications for conditions like gastro-oesophageal reflux disease and irritable bowel syndrome are also provided within the app.

Photo gallery is also provided for ease of understanding by those that may desire to.
